description.last_approved_text: Many of the enemy troops would gladly join our forces; those who refuse will be put to the sword. This will replenish our troops, but may impact our relations with the enemy faction.

campaign_post_battle_captive_options.description: Many of the enemy troops would gladly join our forces; those who refuse will be put to the sword. This will replenish our troops, but may impact our relations with the enemy faction.

description.last_approved_text: Allow the enemy troops to flee, leaving their valuable supplies behind for our soldiers - an excellent choice when deep within enemy territory.

campaign_post_battle_captive_options.description: Allow the enemy troops to flee, leaving their valuable supplies behind for our soldiers - an excellent choice when deep within enemy territory.

description.last_approved_text: To aid an empty treasury, or offset the troops' upkeep, captives can be ransomed back to the enemy; the larger the force, the more money can be made.

campaign_post_battle_captive_options.description: To aid an empty treasury, or offset the troops' upkeep, captives can be ransomed back to the enemy; the larger the force, the more money can be made.
